33  package edu.emory.mathcs.jtransforms.fft;
34  
35  import java.util.ArrayList;
36  import java.util.Collection;
37  import java.util.Random;
38  
39  import junit.framework.Assert;
40  
41  import org.junit.Test;
42  import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
43  import org.junit.runners.Parameterized;
44  import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;
45  
46  import edu.emory.mathcs.utils.ConcurrencyUtils;
47  
48  /**
49   * Test of the utility class {@link RealFFTUtils_3D}.
50   *
51   * @author S&eacute;bastien Brisard
52   *
53   */
54  @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
55  @RunWith(value = Parameterized.class)
56  public class RealFFTUtils_3DTest {
57  	/** Base message of all exceptions. */
58  	public static final String DEFAULT_MESSAGE = "FFT of size %dx%dx%d: ";
59  
60  	/** The constant value of the seed of the random generator. */
61  	public static final int SEED = 20110628;
62  
63  	@Parameters
64  	public static Collection<Object[]> getParameters() {
65  		final int[] size = { 16, 32, 64 };
66  
67  		final ArrayList<Object[]> parameters = new ArrayList<Object[]>();
68  
69  		for (int i = 0; i < size.length; i++) {
70  			for (int j = 0; j < size.length; j++) {
71  				for (int k = 0; k < size.length; k++) {
72  					parameters.add(new Object[] { size[i], size[j], size[k], 1,
73  							SEED });
74  					parameters.add(new Object[] { size[i], size[j], size[k], 4,
75  							SEED });
76  				}
77  			}
78  		}
79  		return parameters;
80  	}
81  
82  	/** Number of columns of the data arrays to be Fourier transformed. */
83  	private final int columns;
84  
85  	/** To perform FFTs on double precision data. */
86  	private final DoubleFFT_3D fft3d;
87  
88  	/** To perform FFTs on single precision data. */
89  	private final FloatFFT_3D fft3f;
90  
91  	/** For the generation of the data arrays. */
92  	private final Random random;
93  
94  	/** Number of rows of the data arrays to be Fourier transformed. */
95  	private final int rows;
96  
97  	/** Number of slices of the data arrays to be Fourier transformed. */
98  	private final int slices;
99  
100 	/** The object to be tested. */
101 	private final RealFFTUtils_3D unpacker;
102 
103 	/**
104 	 * Creates a new instance of this test.
105 	 *
106 	 * @param slices
107 	 *            number of slices
108 	 * @param rows
109 	 *            number of rows
110 	 * @param columns
111 	 *            number of columns
112 	 * @param numThreads
113 	 *            the number of threads to be used
114 	 * @param seed
115 	 *            the seed of the random generator
116 	 */
117 	public RealFFTUtils_3DTest(final int slices, final int rows,
118 			final int columns, final int numThreads, final long seed)
119 	{
120 		this.slices = slices;
121 		this.rows = rows;
122 		this.columns = columns;
123 		this.fft3d = new DoubleFFT_3D(slices, rows, columns);
124 		this.fft3f = new FloatFFT_3D(slices, rows, columns);
125 		this.random = new Random(seed);
126 		this.unpacker = new RealFFTUtils_3D(slices, rows, columns);
127 		ConcurrencyUtils.setNumberOfThreads(numThreads);
128 	}
129 
130 	public FloatingPointEqualityChecker createEqualityChecker(final double rel,
131 			final double abs)
132 	{
133 		final String msg = String
134 				.format(DEFAULT_MESSAGE, slices, rows, columns);
135 		return new FloatingPointEqualityChecker(msg, rel, abs, 0f, 0f);
136 	}
137 
138 	public FloatingPointEqualityChecker createEqualityChecker(final float rel,
139 			final float abs)
140 	{
141 		final String msg = String
142 				.format(DEFAULT_MESSAGE, slices, rows, columns);
143 		return new FloatingPointEqualityChecker(msg, 0d, 0d, rel, abs);
144 	}
145 
146 	@Test
147 	public void testUnpack1dInput() {
148 		final double rel = 1E-8;
149 		final double x0 = 5E-3;
150 		final double abs = rel * x0;
151 		final FloatingPointEqualityChecker checker = createEqualityChecker(rel,
152 				abs);
153 		final double[] actual = new double[slices * rows * columns];
154 		final double[][][] expected = new double[slices][rows][2 * columns];
155 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
156 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
157 				for (int c = 0; c < columns; c++) {
158 					final double rnd = random.nextDouble();
159 					actual[(s * rows + r) * columns + c] = rnd;
160 					expected[s][r][2 * c] = rnd;
161 					expected[s][r][2 * c + 1] = 0d;
162 				}
163 			}
164 		}
165 		fft3d.complexForward(expected);
166 		fft3d.realForward(actual);
167 
168 		double exp, act;
169 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
170 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
171 				for (int c = 0; c < 2 * columns; c++) {
172 					final String msg = String.format("[%d][%d][%d]", s, r, c);
173 					exp = expected[s][r][c];
174 					act = unpacker.unpack(s, r, c, actual, 0);
175 					checker.assertEquals(msg, exp, act);
176 				}
177 			}
178 		}
179 	}
180 
181 	@Test
182 	public void testUnpack1fInput() {
183 		final float rel = 1E-1f;
184 		final float x0 = 5E-3f;
185 		final float abs = rel * x0;
186 		final FloatingPointEqualityChecker checker = createEqualityChecker(rel,
187 				abs);
188 		final float[] actual = new float[slices * rows * columns];
189 		final float[][][] expected = new float[slices][rows][2 * columns];
190 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
191 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
192 				for (int c = 0; c < columns; c++) {
193 					final float rnd = random.nextFloat();
194 					actual[(s * rows + r) * columns + c] = rnd;
195 					expected[s][r][2 * c] = rnd;
196 					expected[s][r][2 * c + 1] = 0f;
197 				}
198 			}
199 		}
200 		fft3f.complexForward(expected);
201 		fft3f.realForward(actual);
202 
203 		float exp, act;
204 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
205 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
206 				for (int c = 0; c < 2 * columns; c++) {
207 					final String msg = String.format("[%d][%d][%d]", s, r, c);
208 					exp = expected[s][r][c];
209 					act = unpacker.unpack(s, r, c, actual, 0);
210 					checker.assertEquals(msg, exp, act);
211 				}
212 			}
213 		}
214 	}

216 	@Test
217 	public void testUnpack3dInput() {
218 		final double rel = 1E-8;
219 		final double x0 = 5E-3;
220 		final double abs = rel * x0;
221 		final FloatingPointEqualityChecker checker = createEqualityChecker(rel,
222 				abs);
223 		final double[][][] actual = new double[slices][rows][columns];
224 		final double[][][] expected = new double[slices][rows][2 * columns];
225 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
226 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
227 				for (int c = 0; c < columns; c++) {
228 					final double rnd = random.nextDouble();
229 					actual[s][r][c] = rnd;
230 					expected[s][r][2 * c] = rnd;
231 					expected[s][r][2 * c + 1] = 0d;
232 				}
233 			}
234 		}
235 		fft3d.complexForward(expected);
236 		fft3d.realForward(actual);
237 
238 		double exp, act;
239 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
240 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
241 				for (int c = 0; c < 2 * columns; c++) {
242 					final String msg = String.format("[%d][%d][%d]", s, r, c);
243 					exp = expected[s][r][c];
244 					act = unpacker.unpack(s, r, c, actual);
245 					checker.assertEquals(msg, exp, act);
246 				}
247 			}
248 		}
249 	}

251 	@Test
252 	public void testUnpack3fInput() {
253 		final float rel = 1E-1f;
254 		final float x0 = 5E-3f;
255 		final float abs = rel * x0;
256 		final FloatingPointEqualityChecker checker = createEqualityChecker(rel,
257 				abs);
258 		final float[][][] actual = new float[slices][rows][columns];
259 		final float[][][] expected = new float[slices][rows][2 * columns];
260 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
261 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
262 				for (int c = 0; c < columns; c++) {
263 					final float rnd = random.nextFloat();
264 					actual[s][r][c] = rnd;
265 					expected[s][r][2 * c] = rnd;
266 					expected[s][r][2 * c + 1] = 0f;
267 				}
268 			}
269 		}
270 		fft3f.complexForward(expected);
271 		fft3f.realForward(actual);
272 
273 		float exp, act;
274 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
275 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
276 				for (int c = 0; c < 2 * columns; c++) {
277 					final String msg = String.format("[%d][%d][%d]", s, r, c);
278 					exp = expected[s][r][c];
279 					act = unpacker.unpack(s, r, c, actual);
280 					checker.assertEquals(msg, exp, act);
281 				}
282 			}
283 		}
284 	}
285 
286 	@Test
287 	public void testPack1dInput() {
288 		final double[] data = new double[slices * rows * columns];
289 		final String msg = String.format(DEFAULT_MESSAGE, slices, rows, columns)
290 				+ "[%d][%d][%d]";
291 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
292 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
293 				for (int c = 0; c < 2 * columns; c++) {
294 					final double expected = random.nextDouble();
295 					try {
296 						unpacker.pack(expected, s, r, c, data, 0);
297 						final double actual = unpacker.unpack(s, r, c, data, 0);
298 						Assert.assertEquals(String.format(msg, s, r, c),
299 								expected, actual, 0.);
300 					} catch (final IllegalArgumentException e) {
301 						// Do nothing
302 					}
303 				}
304 			}
305 		}
306 	}
307 
308 	@Test
309 	public void testPack3dInput() {
310 		final double[][][] data = new double[slices][rows][columns];
311 		final String msg = String.format(DEFAULT_MESSAGE, slices, rows, columns)
312 				+ "[%d][%d][%d]";
313 		for (int s = 0; s < slices; s++) {
314 			for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
315 				for (int c = 0; c < 2 * columns; c++) {
316 					final double expected = random.nextDouble();
317 					try {
318 						unpacker.pack(expected, s, r, c, data);
319 						final double actual = unpacker.unpack(s, r, c, data);
320 						Assert.assertEquals(String.format(msg, s, r, c),
321 								expected, actual, 0.);
322 					} catch (final IllegalArgumentException e) {
323 						// Do nothing
324 					}
325 				}
326 			}
327 		}
328 	}
